info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 2:44PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Grant County through 315 PM MDT... At 244 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Fierro, moving west at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Silver City, Pinos Altos, Hanover, Fierro, Mangas Valley, Little Walnut Village, Cherry Creek Campground and McMillan Campground. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.
